main event: On June 22, 1956, a civilian in Ponaca, Nevada observed a circular silver-gray object, the size of a half dollar, for a period of five minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed with binoculars and had a straight course from west to east.
Despite the presence of a jet aircraft in the area, the object was evaluated as possibly an aircraft.
The observer, a 33-year-old housewife, provided detailed information about the object's position and movement.
The report mentions specific wind speeds and directions at different altitudes during the sighting.
The observation was made at a clear location with no obstructions, and no action was taken as a local jet fighter from Nellis AFB was in the area.
